intro: Trochocarpa gunnii, commonly known as the Gunn's false hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern and eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
